meanings.def: enjoying harming others; morally bad and cruel
examples: Police described the killer as ‘a desperate and evil man’.
an evil genius/dictator
President Reagan referred to the Soviet Union as the ‘evil empire’.
an evil grin
Her face was full of evil intent.
Kristin smiled a particularly evil smile.
He gave an evil laugh.
A broad smile hid his evil intentions.

meanings.def: having a harmful effect on people; morally bad
examples: evil deeds
In his speech he described the evil effects of racism.

meanings.def: connected with the devil and with what is bad in the world
examples: It was an ancient charm to ward off evil spirits.
She had been deceived by an evil demon.
The rubbish bin was giving off an evil smell.

meanings.def: the time when you have to do something difficult or unpleasant
examples: I’d better go and see the dentist—I can’t put off the evil hour any longer.
If you keep on borrowing, you are only postponing the evil day when you have to pay it all back.

meanings.def: a person or spirit who is thought to have a good/bad influence over you
an unpleasant drink that is a mixture of different things

meanings.def: a force that causes bad things to happen; morally bad behaviour
examples: the eternal struggle between good and evil
He believed he could rid the world of the forces of evil.
to fight/combat evil
the battle/fight/struggle/war against evil
He was a good man who was forced to do evil.
You cannot pretend there's no evil in the world.
He sees money as the root of all evil.
His simple message was that God will punish those that do evil.
You can always choose to resist evil.
a duty to defeat the evil of terrorism
the intrinsic evil of taking a human life
the pure evil in his soul
Humans have the capacity to do more evil than any other species on earth.

meanings.def: a bad or harmful thing; the bad effect of something
examples: the evils of drugs/alcohol
They hardly mentioned such social evils as racism and sexism.

meanings.def: the less unpleasant of two unpleasant choices
a thing that is bad or that you do not like but that you must accept for a particular reason
examples: The loss of jobs is regarded as a necessary evil in the fight against inflation.
